description: common meta info, not specific to any code

metaInfos.description: Information that *in theory* should have no influence on the results.
metaInfos.name: accessory_info

metaInfos.description: Forces on the atoms as minus gradient of energy_free, without forces' unitary-transformation (rigid body) filtering and without constraints.
metaInfos.name: atom_forces_free_raw

metaInfos.description: Forces on the atoms as minus gradient of energy_free, including forces' unitary-transformation (rigid body) filtering and including constraints, if present.
metaInfos.name: atom_forces_free

metaInfos.description: Forces on the atoms as minus gradient of energy_total, without forces' unitary-transformation (rigid body) filtering and without constraints.
metaInfos.name: atom_forces_raw

metaInfos.description: Forces on the atoms as minus gradient of energy_total_T0, without forces' unitary-transformation (rigid body) filtering and without constraints.
metaInfos.name: atom_forces_T0_raw

metaInfos.description: Forces on the atoms as minus gradient of energy_total_T0, including forces' unitary-transformation (rigid body) filtering and including constraints, if present.
metaInfos.name: atom_forces_T0

metaInfos.description: Some forces on the atoms (i.e. minus derivatives of some energy with respect to the atom position).
metaInfos.name: atom_forces_type

metaInfos.description: Forces on the atoms as minus gradient of energy_total, including forces' unitary-transformation (rigid body) filtering and including constraints, if present.
metaInfos.name: atom_forces

metaInfos.description: Name (label) of each atom in the molecule.
metaInfos.name: atom_in_molecule_charge

metaInfos.description: Name (label) of each atom in the molecule.
metaInfos.name: atom_in_molecule_name

metaInfos.description: Reference to the atom type of each atom in the molecule.
metaInfos.name: atom_in_molecule_to_atom_type_ref

metaInfos.description: Labels of the atoms. These strings identify the atom kind and conventionally start with the symbol of the atomic species plus possible a number. They can be used for particles that do not correspond to atoms (e.g., ghost atoms in some atom centered codes). This metadata defines a configuration and is required.
metaInfos.name: atom_label

metaInfos.description: Positions of the atoms. This metadata defines a configuration and is required.
metaInfos.name: atom_position

metaInfos.description: Energy values of the atom-projected density of (electronic-energy) states (DOS).
metaInfos.name: atom_projected_dos_energies

metaInfos.description: Tuples of $l$ and $m$ values for which atom_projected_dos_values_lm are given. The integer numbers for $m$ have a different meaning depending on atom_projected_dos_m_kind and this is described in the [m\_kind wiki page](https://gitlab.rzg.mpg.de/nomad-lab/nomad-meta-info/wikis/metainfo/m-kind).
metaInfos.name: atom_projected_dos_lm

metaInfos.description: String describing what the integer numbers of $m$ in atom_projected_dos_lm mean as described in the [m\_kind wiki page](https://gitlab.rzg.mpg.de/nomad-lab/nomad-meta-info/wikis/metainfo/m-kind).
metaInfos.name: atom_projected_dos_m_kind

metaInfos.description: Values (number of states for a given energy, given in atom_projected_dos_energies) of the atom-projected density of (electronic-energy) states, divided into contributions from each $l,m$ channel.
metaInfos.name: atom_projected_dos_values_lm

metaInfos.description: Values (number of states for a given energy, given in atom_projected_dos_energies) of the atom-projected density of (electronic-energy) states (DOS), summed up over all $l$ channels.
metaInfos.name: atom_projected_dos_values_total

metaInfos.description: Table mapping atom to molecules: the first column is the index of the molecule and the second column the index of the atom, signifying that the atom in the second column belongs to the molecule in the first column in the same row.
metaInfos.name: atom_to_molecule

metaInfos.description: Charge of the atom type.
metaInfos.name: atom_type_charge

metaInfos.description: Mass of the atom type.
metaInfos.name: atom_type_mass

metaInfos.description: Name (label) of the atom type.
metaInfos.name: atom_type_name

metaInfos.description: Velocities of the nuclei.
metaInfos.name: atom_velocities

metaInfos.description: String describing the method used to obtain the multipoles as described in the [atomic\_multipole\_kind wiki page](https://gitlab.mpcdf.mpg.de/nomad-lab/nomad-meta-info/wikis/metainfo/atomic-multipole-kind).
metaInfos.name: atomic_multipole_kind

metaInfos.description: Tuples of $l$ and $m$ values for which the atomic multipoles are given. The integer numbers for m have a different meaning depending on atomic_multipole_m_kind and this is described in the [m\_kind wiki page](https://gitlab.rzg.mpg.de/nomad-lab/nomad-meta-info/wikis/metainfo/m-kind).
metaInfos.name: atomic_multipole_lm

metaInfos.description: String describing what the integer numbers of $m$ in atomic_multipole_lm mean as described in the [m\_kind wiki page](https://gitlab.rzg.mpg.de/nomad-lab/nomad-meta-info/wikis/metainfo/m-kind).
metaInfos.name: atomic_multipole_m_kind

metaInfos.description: Value of the dipole (or monopole/charge for $l$ = 0) for each atom, calculated as described in atomic_multipole_kind.
metaInfos.name: atomic_multipole_value

metaInfos.description: Energies of the $k$ bands (electronic band structure).
metaInfos.name: band_energies

metaInfos.description: Fractional coordinates of the $k$ points (i.e. in the basis of the reciprocal lattice vectors) actually building the band.
metaInfos.name: band_k_points

metaInfos.description: Occupation of the $k$-point along the band.
metaInfos.name: band_occupation

metaInfos.description: Start and end labels of the points in the one-dimensional pathway sampled in the $k$-space.
metaInfos.name: band_segm_labels

metaInfos.description: Fractional coordinates of the start and end point (i.e. in the basis of the reciprocal lattice vectors) of the segments sampled in the $k$-space.
metaInfos.name: band_segm_start_end

metaInfos.description: Azimuthal quantum number ($l$) value (of the angular part given by the spherical harmonic $Y_{lm}$) of the basis function.
metaInfos.name: basis_set_atom_centered_ls

metaInfos.description: Radial function of the different basis function kinds, the 5 values are $r$, $f(r)$, $f'(r)$, $f(r)*r$, $\frac{d}{dr}(f(r)*r)$ and are given by default on an equispaced grid from 0 to 4 nm.
metaInfos.name: basis_set_atom_centered_radial_functions

metaInfos.description: Code dependent but explicative base name of the basis function, not unique. Details are explained in the [basis\_set\_atom\_centered\_short\_name wiki page](https://gitlab.mpcdf.mpg.de/nomad-lab/nomad-meta-info/wikis/metainfo/basis-set-atom-centered-short-name), this name should not contain the atom kind (to simplify the use of a single name for multiple elements).
metaInfos.name: basis_set_atom_centered_short_name

metaInfos.description: Code dependent explicative and unique name of the basis function, it uses basis_set_atom_centered_short_name and if not equal to the default basis set implied by that name appends the first 10 characters of the base64 url encoding of the SHA-512 of the diffs stored as normalized json, details are explained in the [basis\_set\_atom\_centered\_name wiki page](https://gitlab.mpcdf.mpg.de/nomad-lab/nomad-meta-info/wikis/metainfo/basis-set-atom-centered-unique-name), this name should not contain the atom kind (to simplify the use of a single name for multiple elements).
metaInfos.name: basis_set_atom_centered_unique_name

metaInfos.description: Atomic number (number of protons) of the atom for which this basis set is thought (0 means unspecified, or a pseudo atom).
metaInfos.name: basis_set_atom_number

metaInfos.description: A cell_associated basis set type. This string should appear as defined in the [basis\_set\_cell\_associated\_kind wiki page](https://gitlab.mpcdf.mpg.de/nomad-lab/nomad-meta-info/wikis/metainfo/basis-set-cell-associated-kind).
metaInfos.name: basis_set_cell_associated_kind

metaInfos.description: A descriptive name identifying the basis set. This string should appear as defined in the [basis\_set\_cell\_associated\_name wiki page](https://gitlab.mpcdf.mpg.de/nomad-lab/nomad-meta-info/wikis/metainfo/basis-set-cell-associated-name).
metaInfos.name: basis_set_cell_associated_name

metaInfos.description: Description of the building blocs of a basis set.
metaInfos.name: basis_set_description

metaInfos.description: String describing the kind of basis set (its use, for example wavefunction). The values are described in the [basis\_set\_kind wiki page](https://gitlab.mpcdf.mpg.de/nomad-lab/nomad-meta-info/wikis/metainfo/basis-set-kind).
metaInfos.name: basis_set_kind

metaInfos.description: String identifying the basis set in an unique way. The values are described in the [basis\_set\_name wiki page](https://gitlab.mpcdf.mpg.de/nomad-lab/nomad-meta-info/wikis/metainfo/basis-set-name).
metaInfos.name: basis_set_name

metaInfos.description: Spherical cutoff  in reciprocal space for a planewave basis set. It is the energy of the highest planewave ($\frac{\hbar^2|k+G|^2}{2m_e}$) kept into the basis. Note that normally the basis set is used for the wavefunctions, and the density would have 4 times the cutoff, but this actually depends on the use of the basis set by the method.
metaInfos.name: basis_set_plan_wave_cutoff

metaInfos.description: String identifying in an unique way the basis set used for the final wavefunctions calculated with XC_method. It should refer (and be the same) to some basis_set_name which is described in the [basis\_set\_name wiki page](https://gitlab.mpcdf.mpg.de/nomad-lab/nomad-meta-info/wikis/metainfo/basis-set-name).
metaInfos.name: basis_set

metaInfos.description: String that represents the method used to calculate the energy_current. If the method is perturbative, this string does not describe the starting point method which should be referenced through section_method_to_method_refs. For scf ab initio calculation, for example, this is composed of XC_method and basis_set and a unique sha, see [calculation\_method\_current wiki page](https://gitlab.mpcdf.mpg.de/nomad-lab/nomad-meta-info/wikis/metainfo/calculation-method-current) for the details.
metaInfos.name: calculation_method_current

metaInfos.description: Kind of method in calculation_method_current: absolute or perturbative.
metaInfos.name: calculation_method_kind

metaInfos.description: String that uniquely represents the method used to calculate energy_total; this consists of calculation_method_current plus '@' and calculation_method of the method_to_method_ref with method_to_method_kind = starting\_point for perturbative methods.
metaInfos.name: calculation_method

metaInfos.description: URL used to reference externally stored calculation as defined in the [calculation\_to\_calculation\_external\_url wiki page](https://gitlab.mpcdf.mpg.de/nomad-lab/nomad-meta-info/wikis/metainfo/calculation-to-calculation-external-url).
metaInfos.name: calculation_to_calculation_external_url

metaInfos.description: String defining the kind of relationship that there is between this and the referenced calculation. Valid values are described in the [calculation\_to\_calculation\_kind wiki page](https://gitlab.mpcdf.mpg.de/nomad-lab/nomad-meta-info/wikis/metainfo/calculation-to-calculation-kind).
metaInfos.name: calculation_to_calculation_kind

metaInfos.description: Reference to another calculation. If both this and calculation_to_calculation_external_url are given, this is assumed to be a local copy of the URL. The kind of relationship is specified by calculation_to_calculation_kind.
metaInfos.name: calculation_to_calculation_ref

metaInfos.description: Properties actually defining the current configuration.
metaInfos.name: configuration_core

metaInfos.description: Which of the lattice vectors use periodic boundary conditions.
metaInfos.name: configuration_periodic_dimensions

metaInfos.description: A quantity that is preserved during the time propagation (for example, kinetic+potential energy during NVE).
metaInfos.name: conserved_quantity

metaInfos.description: List of the indexes involved in this constraint. The fist atom has index 1, the last number_of_topology_atoms.
metaInfos.name: constraint_atoms

metaInfos.description: Short and unique name for this constraint type. Valid names are described in the [constraint\_kind wiki page](https://gitlab.mpcdf.mpg.de/nomad-lab/nomad-meta-info/wikis/metainfo/constraint-kind).
metaInfos.name: constraint_kind

metaInfos.description: Explicit constraint parameters for this kind of constraint (depending on the constraint type, some might be given implicitly through other means).
metaInfos.name: constraint_parameters

metaInfos.description: Energies of the Density of (electronic-energy) states (DOS). This is the total DOS, see atom_projected_dos_energies.
metaInfos.name: dos_energies

metaInfos.description: Values (number of states for a given energy, given in dos_energies) of Density of (electronic-energy) states (DOS).
metaInfos.name: dos_values

metaInfos.description: Values of the (electronic-energy) eigenvalues.
metaInfos.name: eigenvalues_eigenvalues

metaInfos.description: A short string describing the kind of eigenvalues, as defined in the [eigenvalues\_kind wiki page](https://gitlab.mpcdf.mpg.de/nomad-lab/nomad-meta-info/wikis/metainfo/eigenvalues-kind).
metaInfos.name: eigenvalues_kind

metaInfos.description: $k$ points on which the eigenvalues tabulated in eigenvalues_eigenvalues were evaluated.
metaInfos.name: eigenvalues_kpoints

metaInfos.description: Occupation of the eigenstates.
metaInfos.name: eigenvalues_occupation

metaInfos.description: Electronic kinetic energy as defined in XC_method during the scf iterations.
metaInfos.name: electronic_kinetic_energy_scf_iteration

metaInfos.description: Electronic kinetic energy as defined in XC_method.
metaInfos.name: electronic_kinetic_energy

metaInfos.description: Component of the correlation (C) energy at the GGA (or MetaGGA) level using the self-consistent density of the target XC functional (full unscaled value, i.e., not scaled due to exact-exchange mixing).
metaInfos.name: energy_C_mGGA

metaInfos.description: Correlation (C) energy using XC_functional.
metaInfos.name: energy_C

metaInfos.description: At each scf iteration, change of total energy with respect to the previous scf iteration.
metaInfos.name: energy_change_scf_iteration

metaInfos.description: Type of the shifted total energy, created to be comparable among different codes, numerical settings, etc. Details can be found on the [energy\_comparable wiki page](https://gitlab.mpcdf.mpg.de/nomad-lab/nomad-meta-info/wikis/metainfo/energy-comparable).
metaInfos.name: energy_comparable_kind

metaInfos.description: Value of the shifted total energy, created to be comparable among different codes, numerical settings, etc. Details can be found on the [energy\_comparable wiki page](https://gitlab.mpcdf.mpg.de/nomad-lab/nomad-meta-info/wikis/metainfo/energy-comparable).
metaInfos.name: energy_comparable_value

metaInfos.description: A value of an energy component per atom.
metaInfos.name: energy_component_per_atom

metaInfos.description: A value of an energy component, expected to be an extensive property.
metaInfos.name: energy_component

metaInfos.description: Entropy correction, to have a potential energy that compensates the changes in occupation, so that forces at finite T do not need to keep the change of occupation in account. Values during the scf iteration. Defined consistently with XC_method.
metaInfos.name: energy_correction_entropy_scf_iteration

metaInfos.description: Entropy correction, to have a potential energy that compensates the changes in occupation, so that forces at finite T do not need to keep the change of occupation in account. Defined consistently with XC_method.
metaInfos.name: energy_correction_entropy

metaInfos.description: Correction to the density-density electrostatic energy in the sum of eigenvalues (that uses the mixed density on one side), and the fully consistend density-density electrostatic energy during the scf iterations. Defined consistently with XC_method.
metaInfos.name: energy_correction_hartree_scf_iteration

metaInfos.description: Correction to the density-density electrostatic energy in the sum of eigenvalues (that uses the mixed density on one side), and the fully consistend density-density electrostatic energy. Defined consistently with XC_method.
metaInfos.name: energy_correction_hartree

metaInfos.description: Energy calculated with calculation_method_current. energy_current is equal to energy_total for non-perturbative methods. For perturbative methods, energy_current is equal to the correction: energy_total minus energy_total of the calculation_to_calculation_ref with calculation_to_calculation_kind = starting\_point. See also [energy\_current wiki page](https://gitlab.mpcdf.mpg.de/nomad-lab/nomad-meta-info/wikis/metainfo/energy-current).
metaInfos.name: energy_current

metaInfos.description: Total electrostatic energy (nuclei + electrons) during the scf itrations.
metaInfos.name: energy_electrostatic_scf_iteration

metaInfos.description: Total electrostatic energy (nuclei + electrons), defined consistently with calculation_method.
metaInfos.name: energy_electrostatic

metaInfos.description: Free energy (whose minimum gives a density with smeared occupation) calculated with XC_method per atom during the scf iterations.
metaInfos.name: energy_free_per_atom_scf_iteration

metaInfos.description: Free energy (whose minimum gives a density with smeared occupation) calculated with XC_method per atom.
metaInfos.name: energy_free_per_atom

metaInfos.description: Free energy (electronic + ions) (whose minimum gives the smeared occupation density) calculated with the method described in XC_method during the scf iterations.
metaInfos.name: energy_free_scf_iteration

metaInfos.description: Free energy (nuclei + electrons) (whose minimum gives the smeared occupation density calculated with smearing_kind) calculated with the method described in XC_method.
metaInfos.name: energy_free

metaInfos.description: Error in the hartree (electrostatic) potential energy during the scf iterations. Defined consistently with XC_method.
metaInfos.name: energy_hartree_error_scf_iteration

metaInfos.description: Error in the hartree (electrostatic) potential. Defined consistently with XC_method.
metaInfos.name: energy_hartree_error

metaInfos.description: Scaled (depending on the mix paramenter of the functional) exact exchange energy. Defined consistently with XC_method.
metaInfos.name: energy_hartree_fock_X_scaled

metaInfos.description: Converged exact exchange energy (not scaled). Defined consistently with XC_method.
metaInfos.name: energy_hartree_fock_X

metaInfos.description: Energy of the method calculation_method_current. Depending on calculation_method_kind it might be a total energy or only a correction.
metaInfos.name: energy_method_current

metaInfos.description: Energy per atom defined as the sum of the eigenvalues of the hamiltonian matrix defined by XC_method, during the scf iterations.
metaInfos.name: energy_sum_eigenvalues_per_atom_scf_iteration

metaInfos.description: Energy per atom defined as the sum of the eigenvalues of the hamiltonian matrix defined by XC_method.
metaInfos.name: energy_sum_eigenvalues_per_atom

metaInfos.description: Sum of the eigenvalues of the hamiltonian matrix defined by XC_method, during the scf iterations.
metaInfos.name: energy_sum_eigenvalues_scf_iteration

metaInfos.description: Sum of the eigenvalues of the hamiltonian matrix defined by XC_method.
metaInfos.name: energy_sum_eigenvalues

metaInfos.description: Total energy using XC_method per atom, extapolated to $T=0$, based on a free electron gas argument.
metaInfos.name: energy_T0_per_atom

metaInfos.description: A value of a total potential energy per atom. Different total energies methods might have different energy zeros, and so they might not be directly comparable.
metaInfos.name: energy_total_potential_per_atom

metaInfos.description: A value of a total potential energy. Different total energies methods might have different energy zeros, and so they might not be directly comparable.
metaInfos.name: energy_total_potential

metaInfos.description: Total electronic energy calculated with XC_method during the scf iterations.
metaInfos.name: energy_total_scf_iteration

metaInfos.description: Total energy using XC_method per atom extapolated to $T=0$, based on a free electron gas argument, during the scf iterations.
metaInfos.name: energy_total_T0_per_atom_scf_iteration

metaInfos.description: Total energy using XC_method per atom extapolated to $T=0$, based on a free electron gas argument.
metaInfos.name: energy_total_T0_per_atom

metaInfos.description: Total energy (or equivalently free energy) calculated with XC_method extrapolated to $T=0$, based on a free electron gas argument, during the scf iterations.
metaInfos.name: energy_total_T0_scf_iteration

metaInfos.description: Total energy (or equivalently free energy), nuclei + electrons, calculated with the method described in XC_method and extrapolated to $T=0$, based on a free electron gas argument.
metaInfos.name: energy_total_T0

metaInfos.description: Total energy (nuclei + electrons) calculated with the method described in calculation_method.
metaInfos.name: energy_total

metaInfos.description: Some correlation (C) energy.
metaInfos.name: energy_type_C

metaInfos.description: Some kind of converged van der Waals energy.
metaInfos.name: energy_type_van_der_Waals

metaInfos.description: Some exchange-correlation (XC) energy.
metaInfos.name: energy_type_XC

metaInfos.description: Some exchange (X) energy.
metaInfos.name: energy_type_X

metaInfos.description: Some energy value.
metaInfos.name: energy_value

metaInfos.description: Method used to compute van der Waals energy stored in energy_van_der_Waals_value. This is used when more than one van der Waals methods are applied in the same single configuration calculation. The main van der Waals method (the one concurring to energy_current and used, e.g., for evaluating the forces for a relaxation or dynamics, is given in energy_van_der_Waals and defined in settings_van_der_Waals.
metaInfos.name: energy_van_der_Waals_kind

metaInfos.description: Value of van der Waals energy, calculated with the method defined in energy_van_der_Waals_kind. This is used when more than one van der Waals methods are applied in the same single configuration calculation. The main van der Waals method (the one concurring to energy_current and used, e.g., for evaluating the forces for a relaxation or dynamics is given in energy_van_der_Waals and defined in settings_van_der_Waals.
metaInfos.name: energy_van_der_Waals_value

metaInfos.description: Converged van der Waals energy calculated using the method described in van_der_Waals_method, and used in energy_current. This is the main van der Waals method (consistent with, e.g., forces used for relaxation or dynamics). Alternative methods are listed in section_energy_van_der_Waals.
metaInfos.name: energy_van_der_Waals

metaInfos.description: Component of the exchange (X) energy at the GGA (or MetaGGA) level, using the self consistent density of the target functional, scaled accordingly to the mixing parameter.
metaInfos.name: energy_X_mGGA_scaled

metaInfos.description: Component of the exchange (X) energy at the GGA (or MetaGGA) level using the self consistent density of the target functional (full unscaled value, i.e., not scaled due to exact-exchange mixing).
metaInfos.name: energy_X_mGGA

metaInfos.description: Exchange-correlation (XC) energy calculated with XC_functional.
metaInfos.name: energy_XC_functional

metaInfos.description: Exchange Correlation (XC) potential energy: the integral of the first order functional derivative of the XC_functional (integral of v_xc*electron_density), i.e., the component of xc that is in the sum of the eigenvalues. Typically DFT only. Value during the SCF cycle (not converged).
metaInfos.name: energy_XC_potential_scf_iteration

metaInfos.description: Exchange Correlation (XC) potential energy: the integral of the first order functional derivative of XC_functional (integral of v_xc*electron_density), i.e., the component of XC that is in the sum of the eigenvalues. Typically DFT only. Value associated with the configuration, should be the most converged value.
metaInfos.name: energy_XC_potential

metaInfos.description: XC energy (integral of e_xc in the DFT case), during the scf iterations, using XC_method.
metaInfos.name: energy_XC_scf_iteration

metaInfos.description: Final exchange-correlation (XC) energy calculated with XC_method.
metaInfos.name: energy_XC

metaInfos.description: Exchange (X) energy using XC_functional.
metaInfos.name: energy_X

metaInfos.description: Kind of sampled ensemble; valid values are defined in the [ensemble\_type wiki page](https://gitlab.mpcdf.mpg.de/nomad-lab/nomad-meta-info/wikis/metainfo/ensemble-type).
metaInfos.name: ensemble_type

metaInfos.description: Some estimate of a quantity contributing to the error of some values.
metaInfos.name: error_estimate_partial

metaInfos.description: Some estimate of the error on the converged (final) value.
metaInfos.name: error_estimate

metaInfos.description: Average of energy-like frame_sequence_conserved_quantity and its standard deviation in this sequence of frames (a frame is one section_single_configuration_calculation). This should be defined if number_of_frames_in_sequence is large.
metaInfos.name: frame_sequence_conserved_quantity_stats

metaInfos.description: Energy-like conserved quantity, i.e., a quantity that should be conserved by the evalution (for example the total energy in the NVE ensemble) along this sequence of frames (frame = configuration).
metaInfos.name: frame_sequence_conserved_quantity

metaInfos.description: Type of continuation that has been performed from the previous sequence. Allowed values are: pos (position of atom and cell only), pos_vel (also the velocities are restarted), all (everything is restarted, including thermostats,...).
metaInfos.name: frame_sequence_continuation_kind

metaInfos.description: Reference to an external evaluation as described in the [frame\_sequence\_external\_url wiki page](https://gitlab.mpcdf.mpg.de/nomad-lab/nomad-meta-info/wikis/metainfo/frame-sequence-external-url).
metaInfos.name: frame_sequence_external_url

metaInfos.description: Average kinetic energy and standard deviation of this sequence of frames (a frame is one section_single_configuration_calculation). This should be defined if number_of_frames_in_sequence is large.
metaInfos.name: frame_sequence_kinetic_energy_stats

metaInfos.description: Kinetic energy along this sequence of frames (a frame is one section_single_configuration_calculation).
metaInfos.name: frame_sequence_kinetic_energy

metaInfos.description: Reference to local frames (a frame is one section_single_configuration_calculation), if not defined then frame_sequence_external_url *must* be defined, if both are defined this is expected to be a local copy of the reference.
metaInfos.name: frame_sequence_local_frames_ref

metaInfos.description: Average potential energy and standard deviation of this of sequence frames (a frame is one section_single_configuration_calculation). This should be defined if number_of_frames_in_sequence is large.
metaInfos.name: frame_sequence_potential_energy_stats

metaInfos.description: Potential energy along this sequence of frames (a frame is one section_single_configuration_calculation). This should be equal to energy_total of the frames (remove?).
metaInfos.name: frame_sequence_potential_energy

metaInfos.description: Average pressure and standard deviation of this sequence of frames (a frame is one section_single_configuration_calculation). This should be defined if number_of_frames_in_sequence is large.
metaInfos.name: frame_sequence_pressure_stats

metaInfos.description: Pressure along this sequence of frames (a frame is one section_single_configuration_calculation).
metaInfos.name: frame_sequence_pressure

metaInfos.description: Average temperature and standard deviation of this sequence of frames (a frame is one section_single_configuration_calculation). This should be defined if number_of_frames_in_sequence is large.
metaInfos.name: frame_sequence_temperature_stats

metaInfos.description: Instantaneus temperature (related to kinetic energy) along this sequence of frames.
metaInfos.name: frame_sequence_temperature

metaInfos.description: Time value along this sequence of frames (a frame is one section_single_configuration_calculation).
metaInfos.name: frame_sequence_time

metaInfos.description: Reference to the sampling method section defining the parameters used in this sequence of frames (a frame is one section_single_configuration_calculation).
metaInfos.name: frame_sequence_to_sampling_ref

metaInfos.description: Name of a user defined quantity, sampled along this sequence of frames (a frame is one section_single_configuration_calculation).
metaInfos.name: frame_sequence_user_quantity_name

metaInfos.description: Average of frame_sequence_user_quantity and its standard deviation in this sequence of frames (a frame is one section_single_configuration_calculation). This should be defined if number_of_frames_in_sequence is large.
metaInfos.name: frame_sequence_user_quantity_stats

metaInfos.description: User specified quantity defined in frame_sequence_user_quantity_name, evaluated along this sequence of frames (a frame is one section_single_configuration_calculation).
metaInfos.name: frame_sequence_user_quantity

metaInfos.description: Determines whether a geometry optimization is converged.
metaInfos.name: geometry_optimization_converged

metaInfos.description: List of the indexes involved in this interaction. The fist atom has index 1, the last atom index number_of_topology_atoms.
metaInfos.name: interaction_atoms

metaInfos.description: Short and unique name for this interaction type. Valid names are described in the [interaction\_kind wiki page](https://gitlab.mpcdf.mpg.de/nomad-lab/nomad-meta-info/wikis/metainfo/interaction-kind).
metaInfos.name: interaction_kind

metaInfos.description: Explicit interaction parameters for this kind of interaction (depending on the interaction_kind some might be given implicitly through other means).
metaInfos.name: interaction_parameters

metaInfos.description: For each section_basis_set, assignent of a basis set (as given in section_basis_set_atom_centered) to an atom.
metaInfos.name: mapping_section_basis_set_atom_centered

metaInfos.description: For each section_basis_set, assignement of the cell-associated (i.e., non atom centered) parts of the basis set (as given in section_basis_set_cell_associated).
metaInfos.name: mapping_section_basis_set_cell_associated

metaInfos.description: A debugging message of the computational program, associated with a single configuration calculation.
metaInfos.name: message_debug_evaluation

metaInfos.description: A debugging message of the computational program, associated with a run.
metaInfos.name: message_debug_run

metaInfos.description: A debugging message of the computational program.
metaInfos.name: message_debug

metaInfos.description: An error message of the computational program, associated with a single configuration calculation.
metaInfos.name: message_error_evaluation

metaInfos.description: An error message of the computational program, associated with a run.
metaInfos.name: message_error_run

metaInfos.description: An error message of the computational program.
metaInfos.name: message_error

metaInfos.description: An information message of the computational program, associated with a a single configuration calculation.
metaInfos.name: message_info_evaluation

metaInfos.description: An information message of the computational program, associated with a run.
metaInfos.name: message_info_run

metaInfos.description: An information message of the computational program.
metaInfos.name: message_info

metaInfos.description: A warning message of the computational program.
metaInfos.name: message_warning_evaluation

metaInfos.description: A warning message of the computational program, associated with a run.
metaInfos.name: message_warning_run

metaInfos.description: A warning message of the computational program.
metaInfos.name: message_warning

metaInfos.description: Atomic number (number of protons) of this atom kind, use 0 if not an atom.
metaInfos.name: method_atom_kind_atom_number

metaInfos.description: String used to identify the atoms of this kind. This should correspond to the atom_label of the configuration. It is possible for one atom kind to have multiple labels (in order to allow two atoms of the same kind to have two differently defined sets of atom-centered basis functions or two different pseudopotentials). Atom kind is typically the symbol of the atomic species but it can be also a ghost or pseudoatom.
metaInfos.name: method_atom_kind_label

metaInfos.description: Reference to the atom-centered orbitals basis functions that are used for the atoms of this kind.
metaInfos.name: method_atom_kind_wavefunctions_basis_set_ref

metaInfos.description: URL used to reference externally stored methods as defined in the [method\_to\_method\_external\_url wiki page](https://gitlab.mpcdf.mpg.de/nomad-lab/nomad-meta-info/wikis/metainfo/method-to-method-external-url).
metaInfos.name: method_to_method_external_url

metaInfos.description: String describing the relationship between the referenced method defined in the present section_method. Valid values are described in the [method\_to\_method\_kind page](https://gitlab.mpcdf.mpg.de/nomad-lab/nomad-meta-info/wikis/metainfo/method-to-method-kind).
metaInfos.name: method_to_method_kind

metaInfos.description: Reference to a local method. If both method_to_method_ref and method_to_method_external_url are given, then method_to_method_ref is expected to contain a local copy of the value contained in method_to_method_external_url. The kind of relationship between the method defined in the present section_method and the referenced one is described by method_to_method_kind.
metaInfos.name: method_to_method_ref

metaInfos.description: Reference to the topology and force fields to be used.
metaInfos.name: method_to_topology_ref

metaInfos.description: List of the indexes involved in this constraint. The fist atom has index 1, the last index is number_of_atoms_in_molecule.
metaInfos.name: molecule_constraint_atoms

metaInfos.description: Short and unique name for this constraint type. Valid names are described in the [constraint\_kind wiki page](https://gitlab.mpcdf.mpg.de/nomad-lab/nomad-meta-info/wikis/metainfo/constraint-kind).
metaInfos.name: molecule_constraint_kind

metaInfos.description: Explicit constraint parameters for this kind of constraint (depending on the constraint type some might be given implicitly through other means).
metaInfos.name: molecule_constraint_parameters

metaInfos.description: List of the indexes involved in this bonded interaction within a molecule. The first atom has index 1, the last index is number_of_atoms_in_molecule.
metaInfos.name: molecule_interaction_atoms

metaInfos.description: Short and unique name for this interaction type, used for bonded interactions for atoms in a molecule. Valid names are described in the [interaction\_kind wiki page](https://gitlab.mpcdf.mpg.de/nomad-lab/nomad-meta-info/wikis/metainfo/interaction-kind).
metaInfos.name: molecule_interaction_kind

metaInfos.description: Explicit interaction parameters for this kind of interaction (depending on the interaction type some might be given implicitly through other means), used for bonded interactions for atoms in a molecule.
metaInfos.name: molecule_interaction_parameters

metaInfos.description: Mapping from molecules to molecule types.
metaInfos.name: molecule_to_molecule_type_map

metaInfos.description: Name of the molecule.
metaInfos.name: molecule_type_name

metaInfos.description: Number of energy values for the atom-projected density of states (DOS).
metaInfos.name: n_atom_projected_dos_values

metaInfos.description: Number of energy values for the density of states (DOS).
metaInfos.name: n_dos_values

metaInfos.description: Number of $k$ points in each segment of the band structure.
metaInfos.name: n_k_points_per_segment

metaInfos.description: Number of energy values for the species-projected density of states (DOS).
metaInfos.name: n_species_projected_dos_values

metaInfos.description: Number of atoms in this molecule.
metaInfos.name: number_of_atoms_in_molecule

metaInfos.description: Number of atoms involved in this constraint.
metaInfos.name: number_of_atoms_per_constraint

metaInfos.description: Number of atoms involved in this interaction.
metaInfos.name: number_of_atoms_per_interaction

metaInfos.description: Number of atoms, in this molecule, involved in this constraint.
metaInfos.name: number_of_atoms_per_molecule_constraint

metaInfos.description: Number of atoms, in this molecule, involved in this interaction.
metaInfos.name: number_of_atoms_per_molecule_interaction

metaInfos.description: Total number of atoms.
metaInfos.name: number_of_atoms

metaInfos.description: Number of different basis functions in this set. This is equal to the number of actual coefficents that are specified when using this basis set.
metaInfos.name: number_of_basis_functions_in_basis_set_atom_centered

metaInfos.description: Total number of basis functions (some might need complex coefficients).
metaInfos.name: number_of_basis_functions

metaInfos.description: Number of constraints of this type.
metaInfos.name: number_of_constraints

metaInfos.description: Number of kpoints.
metaInfos.name: number_of_eigenvalues_kpoints

metaInfos.description: Number of eigenvalues.
metaInfos.name: number_of_eigenvalues

metaInfos.description: Dimension of the user-defined quantity (monitored in a sequence of frames, i.e., a trajectory).
metaInfos.name: number_of_frame_sequence_user_quantity_components

metaInfos.description: The number of frames in this sequence (a frame is one section_single_configuration_calculation).
metaInfos.name: number_of_frames_in_sequence

metaInfos.description: Number of interactions of this type.
metaInfos.name: number_of_interactions

metaInfos.description: Number of $k$ point segments.
metaInfos.name: number_of_k_point_segments

metaInfos.description: Number of different kinds of radial basis functions in this set. In practice, all the basis functions with the same $n$ and $l$ quantum number, here are counted only once.
metaInfos.name: number_of_kinds_in_basis_set_atom_centered

metaInfos.description: Number of $l,m$ combinations for which atom projected density of states (DOS) are given.
metaInfos.name: number_of_lm_atom_projected_dos

metaInfos.description: Number of $l,m$ combinations for which atomic multipoles are given.
metaInfos.name: number_of_lm_atomic_multipoles

metaInfos.description: Number of $l,m$ combinations for which species-projected density of states (DOS) are given.
metaInfos.name: number_of_lm_species_projected_dos

metaInfos.description: Number of constraints of this type.
metaInfos.name: number_of_molecule_constraints

metaInfos.description: Number of bonded interactions of this type.
metaInfos.name: number_of_molecule_interactions

metaInfos.description: Number of species for the species-projected density of states (DOS).
metaInfos.name: number_of_species

metaInfos.description: Number of atoms in the system described by this topology.
metaInfos.name: number_of_topology_atoms

metaInfos.description: Number of molecules in the system, as described by this topology.
metaInfos.name: number_of_topology_molecules

metaInfos.description: Information on the parallelization of the program.
metaInfos.name: parallelization_info

metaInfos.description: A debugging message of the parsing program, associated with a single configuration calculation.
metaInfos.name: parsing_message_debug_evaluation

metaInfos.description: A debugging message of the parsing program, associated with a run.
metaInfos.name: parsing_message_debug_run

metaInfos.description: A debugging message of the parsing program.
metaInfos.name: parsing_message_debug

metaInfos.description: An error message of the parsing program, associated with a run.
metaInfos.name: parsing_message_error_run

metaInfos.description: An error message of the parsing program, associated with a single configuration calculation.
metaInfos.name: parsing_message_error_single_configuration

metaInfos.description: An error message of the parsing program.
metaInfos.name: parsing_message_error

metaInfos.description: An information message of the parsing program, associated with a run.
metaInfos.name: parsing_message_info_run

metaInfos.description: An information message of the parsing program, associated with a a single configuration calculation.
metaInfos.name: parsing_message_info_single_configuration

metaInfos.description: An information message of the parsing program.
metaInfos.name: parsing_message_info

metaInfos.description: A warning message of the parsing program.
metaInfos.name: parsing_message_warning_evaluation

metaInfos.description: A warning message of the parsing program, associated with a run.
metaInfos.name: parsing_message_warning_run

metaInfos.description: A warning message of the parsing program.
metaInfos.name: parsing_message_warning

metaInfos.description: Post Hartree-Fock method in standarized form. This is not fully unique. Some of the methods are: full-CI; CCS,CCS(D), CCSD, CCSD(T), CCSDT(Q)...; MP2, MP3, MP4,...; GW; MCSCF,CASSCF,CASPT2,MRCISD. The list should be extended or improved in particular with respect to the multi reference or local methods. If the value is absent or '', then no post hartree_fock method has been used.
metaInfos.name: post_hartree_fock_method

metaInfos.description: Reference from the present sequence of frames (i.e., trajectory; a frame is one section_single_configuration_calculation), to the previous sequence. If not given, a start from an initial configuration is assumed.
metaInfos.name: previous_sequence_ref

metaInfos.description: Type of basis set used by the program to represent the wavefunctions, valid values are given in the [basis set type wiki page](https://gitlab.mpcdf.mpg.de/nomad-lab/nomad-meta-info/wikis/metainfo/program-basis-set-type).
metaInfos.name: program_basis_set_type

metaInfos.description: Program compilation date and time as seconds from unix epoch (00:00:00 UTC on 1 January 1970) in seconds. Default to GMT timezone for date and times without timezone.
metaInfos.name: program_compilation_datetime

metaInfos.description: Host on which the program was compiled.
metaInfos.name: program_compilation_host

metaInfos.description: Information on the program that generated the data.
metaInfos.name: program_info

metaInfos.description: Name of the program that generated the data.
metaInfos.name: program_name

metaInfos.description: Version of the program that was used. Should contain either the official version name or the referenze hashtag of a git repository as well as the location of the repository.
metaInfos.name: program_version

metaInfos.description: Short string describing the relativistic treatment used for the calculation of the final energy and related quantities. No relativistic treatment, if skipped or empty. Relativistic treatment strings are described on the [relativity\_method wiki page](https://gitlab.mpcdf.mpg.de/nomad-lab/nomad-meta-info/wikis/metainfo/relativity-method).
metaInfos.name: relativity_method

metaInfos.description: True, if this run was terminated properly. If false, the run might have been killed or ended with an error.
metaInfos.name: run_clean_end

metaInfos.description: Hosts that did run this simulation, this is a mapping, host->json value that might give extra program dependent information on how that host is used.
metaInfos.name: run_hosts

metaInfos.description: Type of method used to do the sampling [sampling_method wiki page](https://gitlab.mpcdf.mpg.de/nomad-lab/nomad-meta-info/wikis/metainfo/sampling-method).
metaInfos.name: sampling_method

metaInfos.description: Number of scf iterations at DFT level.
metaInfos.name: scf_dft_number_of_iterations

metaInfos.description: Information on the scf procedure.
metaInfos.name: scf_info

metaInfos.description: Section collecting the information on a atom projected density of states (DOS) evaluation.
metaInfos.name: section_atom_projected_dos

metaInfos.description: Section describing a type of atom in the system.
metaInfos.name: section_atom_type

metaInfos.description: Section describing multipoles (charges, dipole,...) for each atom.
metaInfos.name: section_atomic_multipoles

metaInfos.description: Section describing one or a sub group of basis functions in an atom centered basis set.
metaInfos.name: section_basis_functions_atom_centered

metaInfos.description: Each section_basis_set_atom_centered contains the definition of a specific atom centered basis set for a specific atom.
metaInfos.name: section_basis_set_atom_centered

metaInfos.description: Section describing a cell associated (atom independent) basis set, e.g., planewaves.
metaInfos.name: section_basis_set_cell_associated

metaInfos.description: Section containing references to all basis sets used for a single configuration calculation. More than one basis set instance per single configuration calculation may be needed, for example, for codes that implement adaptive basis sets along the scf convergence (see, .e.g., exciting). In such cases, there is a section_basis_set instance per scf iteration, if necessary. Another example is having a basis set for wavefunctions, a differet one for the density, an auxiliary basis set for resolution of identity (RI), etc.
metaInfos.name: section_basis_set

metaInfos.description: Section that describes relationships between single configuration calculations.
metaInfos.name: section_calculation_to_calculation_refs

metaInfos.description: Section describing a constraint between arbitrary atoms.
metaInfos.name: section_constraint

metaInfos.description: Section collecting the information on a (electronic-energy) density of states (DOS) evaluation.
metaInfos.name: section_dos

metaInfos.description: Groups eigenvalues of different spins.
metaInfos.name: section_eigenvalues_group

metaInfos.description: Section containing eigenvalues of some energy for one spin channel.
metaInfos.name: section_eigenvalues

metaInfos.description: Section describing a shifted total energy, created to be comparable among different codes, numerical settings, etc. Details can be found on the [energy\_comparable wiki page](https://gitlab.mpcdf.mpg.de/nomad-lab/nomad-meta-info/wikis/metainfo/energy-comparable).
metaInfos.name: section_energy_comparable

metaInfos.description: Section containing a van der Waals energy value energy_van_der_Waals_value, of type van_der_Waals_kind. This is used when more than one van der Waals methods are applied in the same single configuration calculation. The main van der Waals method (the one concurring to energy_current and used, e.g., for evaluating the forces for a relaxation or dynamics is given in energy_van_der_Waals and defined in settings_van_der_Waals.
metaInfos.name: section_energy_van_der_Waals

metaInfos.description: Section collecting some user-defined quantities evaluated along a sequence of frames (i.e., a trajectory, a frame is one section_single_configuration_calculation).
metaInfos.name: section_frame_sequence_user_quantity

metaInfos.description: Section containing a sequence of frames (i.e., a trajectory, a frame is one section_single_configuration_calculation), evaluated with a common sampling method; this might be a subset of the whole trajectory.
metaInfos.name: section_frame_sequence

metaInfos.description: Section containing the description of a bonded interaction between arbitrary atoms.
metaInfos.name: section_interaction

metaInfos.description: Section collecting the information on a $k$-band evaluation.
metaInfos.name: section_k_band

metaInfos.description: Every section_method_atom_kind contains method related information about a kind of atom, and is identified by one or more string method_atom_kind_label. This categorisation into atom kinds is more flexible than just atomic species, because to different atoms of the same species different atom-centered basis sets or pseudopotentials may be assigned. So, if for instance two different oxygen atoms are assigned two different basis sets or pseudopotentials, we have two distinguish them into two different *kinds* of O atoms, by creating two distinct section_method_atom_kind.
metaInfos.name: section_method_atom_kind

metaInfos.description: Section describing connections between methods used for the same configuration (for example the starting point of a perturbation, or the QM and MM methods in a QM/MM method.
metaInfos.name: section_method_to_method_refs

metaInfos.description: Section containing the various parameters that define the theory used and the approximations done (convergence, thresholds,...) to perform a single configuration calculation. It does *not* contain the settings for dynamics, goemetry optimization,etc.
metaInfos.name: section_method

metaInfos.description: Section describing a constraint between atoms within a molecule.
metaInfos.name: section_molecule_constraint

metaInfos.description: Section describing a bonded interaction between atoms within a molecule.
metaInfos.name: section_molecule_interaction

metaInfos.description: Section describing a type of molecule in the system.
metaInfos.name: section_molecule_type

metaInfos.description: Every section_run represents a single call of a program. What exactly is contained in a run depends on the run type and the program.
metaInfos.name: section_run

metaInfos.description: Section containing the settings describing a sampling (of the potential-energy surface) method.
metaInfos.name: section_sampling_method

metaInfos.description: Every section_scf_iteration section represents an scf iteration.
metaInfos.name: section_scf_iteration

metaInfos.description: Every section_single_configuration_calculation contains the values computed during a single configuration calculation.
metaInfos.name: section_single_configuration_calculation

metaInfos.description: Section collecting the information on a species-projected density of states (DOS) evaluation.
metaInfos.name: section_species_projected_dos

metaInfos.description: Section collecting alternative values to stress_tensor that have been calculated.
metaInfos.name: section_stress_tensor

metaInfos.description: Every section_system_description contains the properties required to describe the physical system simulated, i.e., the given atomic configuration, the definition of periodic cell (if present), external potentials,etc.
metaInfos.name: section_system_description

metaInfos.description: Section containing the definition of topology (connectivity among atoms in force fileds), force field, and constraints of a system.
metaInfos.name: section_topology

metaInfos.description: Section containing one of the exchange correlation (XC) functionals that are combined to form the XC_functional used in the present section_method.
metaInfos.name: section_XC_functionals

metaInfos.description: Short string for the self interaction correction (SIC) treatment used to calculate the final energy and related quantities. No special treatment if skipped or empty. Other SIC treatment strings as described on the [self\_interaction\_correction\_method wiki page](https://gitlab.mpcdf.mpg.de/nomad-lab/nomad-meta-info/wikis/metainfo/self-interaction-correction-method).
metaInfos.name: self_interaction_correction_method

metaInfos.description: Parameters of an atom within a molecule.
metaInfos.name: settings_atom_in_molecule

metaInfos.description: Parameters controlling the barostat.
metaInfos.name: settings_barostat

metaInfos.description: Some parameters that describe a constraint
metaInfos.name: settings_constraint

metaInfos.description: Coupled-Clusters method parameters.
metaInfos.name: settings_coupled_cluster

metaInfos.description: GW-method parameters.
metaInfos.name: settings_GW

metaInfos.description: Parameters controlling the MD integrator.
metaInfos.name: settings_integrator

metaInfos.description: Some parameters that describe a bonded interaction.
metaInfos.name: settings_interaction

metaInfos.description: Parameters that control the $k$-point mesh.
metaInfos.name: settings_k_points

metaInfos.description: Multi-configurational self-consistent-field method parameters.
metaInfos.name: settings_MCSCF

metaInfos.description: Parameters controlling the Monte-Carlo sampling.
metaInfos.name: settings_mc

metaInfos.description: Parameters controlling the MD sampling.
metaInfos.name: settings_md

metaInfos.description: Parameters controlling the metadynamics sampling.
metaInfos.name: settings_metadynamics

metaInfos.description: Møller–Plesset perturbation theory parameters.
metaInfos.name: settings_moller_plesset_perturbation_theory

metaInfos.description: Multireference single and double configuration interaction method parameters.
metaInfos.name: settings_multi_reference

metaInfos.description: Post hartree-fock method parameters.
metaInfos.name: settings_post_hartree_fock

metaInfos.description: Parameters and information connected with the relativistic treatment used in the calculation.
metaInfos.name: settings_relativity

metaInfos.description: Parameters that control the whole run (but not the single configuration calculation).
metaInfos.name: settings_run

metaInfos.description: Parameters and information connected with self-interaction correction (SIC) method used.
metaInfos.name: settings_self_interaction_correction

metaInfos.description: Parameters controlling the smearing of the orbital occupation (finite electronic temperature).
metaInfos.name: settings_smearing

metaInfos.description: Settings to calculate stress_tensor, consistent with energy_total.
metaInfos.name: settings_stress_tensor

metaInfos.description: Parameters controlling the thermostat used in MD.
metaInfos.name: settings_thermostat

metaInfos.description: Parameters and information connected with the van der Waals treatment used in the calculation to compute energy_van_der_Waals.
metaInfos.name: settings_van_der_Waals

metaInfos.description: Parameters connected with defining the exchange-correlation (XC) functional.
metaInfos.name: settings_XC_functional

metaInfos.description: Parameters connected with defining the exchange-correlation (XC) treatment.
metaInfos.name: settings_XC

metaInfos.description: Simulation cell (lattice vectors). The first index is x,y,z and the second index the lattice vector.
metaInfos.name: simulation_cell

metaInfos.description: Determines whether a single configuration calculation is converged.
metaInfos.name: single_configuration_calculation_converged

metaInfos.description: Reference to the system (atomic configuration, cell, ...) that is calculated.
metaInfos.name: single_configuration_calculation_to_system_description_ref

metaInfos.description: Reference to the method used for the calculation.
metaInfos.name: single_configuration_to_calculation_method_ref

metaInfos.description: The kind of smearing on the electron occupation used to calculate energy_free, valid values are given in the [smearing\_kind wiki page](https://gitlab.mpcdf.mpg.de/nomad-lab/nomad-meta-info/wikis/metainfo/smearing-kind).
metaInfos.name: smearing_kind

metaInfos.description: The width of the smearing in energy for the electon occupation used to calculate energy_free (if the method specified in smearing_kind uses it).
metaInfos.name: smearing_width

metaInfos.description: References to the source of the data (URI,etc.).
metaInfos.name: source_references

metaInfos.description: International Union of Crystallography number of the 3D space group.
metaInfos.name: spacegroup_3D_number

metaInfos.description: Energies of the species-projected density of states (DOS).
metaInfos.name: species_projected_dos_energies

metaInfos.description: Tuples of $l$ and $m$ values for which species_projected_dos_values_lm are given. The integer numbers for $m$ have a different meaning depending on species_projected_dos_m_kind and this is described in the [m\_kind wiki page](https://gitlab.rzg.mpg.de/nomad-lab/nomad-meta-info/wikis/metainfo/m-kind).
metaInfos.name: species_projected_dos_lm

metaInfos.description: String describing what the integer numbers of $m$ in species_projected_dos_lm mean, as described in the [m\_kind wiki page](https://gitlab.rzg.mpg.de/nomad-lab/nomad-meta-info/wikis/metainfo/m-kind).
metaInfos.name: species_projected_dos_m_kind

metaInfos.description: Species labels for the species-projected density of states (DOS).
metaInfos.name: species_projected_dos_species_label

metaInfos.description: Values (number of states for a given energy, given in species_projected_dos_energies) of species-projected density of states (DOS) values, divided into contributions from each $l,m$ channel.
metaInfos.name: species_projected_dos_values_lm

metaInfos.description: Values (number of states for a given energy, given in species_projected_dos_energies) of species-projected density of states (DOS) values, summed up over all $l$.
metaInfos.name: species_projected_dos_values_total

metaInfos.description: Value of the total spin moment operator $S^2$ during the scf iterations of XC_method. It can be used to calculate the spin contamination in spin-unrestricted calculations.
metaInfos.name: spin_S2_scf_iteration

metaInfos.description: Value of the total spin moment operator $S^2$ for the converged wavefunctions calculated with the XC_method, which can be used to calculate the spin contamination in spin-unrestricted calculations.
metaInfos.name: spin_S2

metaInfos.description: Method used to compute the stress tensor stored in stress_tensor_value. This is an *alternative* to the stress tensor defined in stress_tensor_method. The value of the latter is stored in stress_tensor and (if needed) it is the one used for dynamics, minimization,etc.
metaInfos.name: stress_tensor_kind

metaInfos.description: Method used to calculate stress_tensor, the value of which is used (if needed) for dynamics, geometry minimization,...  The value should be with numeric or analytic.
metaInfos.name: stress_tensor_method

metaInfos.description: A final value of a stress tensor
metaInfos.name: stress_tensor_type

metaInfos.description: Stress tensor of kind stress_tensor_kind, which is an *alternative* to the one chosen in stress_tensor_method. The value of the latter is stored in stress_tensor and (if needed) it is the one used for dynamics, minimization,etc..
metaInfos.name: stress_tensor_value

metaInfos.description: A final value of the default stress tensor of energy_total calculated with stress_tensor_method.
metaInfos.name: stress_tensor

metaInfos.description: Name of the system (for debugging/visualization purposes).
metaInfos.name: system_name

metaInfos.description: Target (user-imposed) value of the multiplicity $M=2S+1$ where $S$ is the total spin. It is an integer number. This value is not necessarly reached.
metaInfos.name: target_multiplicity

metaInfos.description: Wall-time needed for a calculation, using calculation_method_current.
metaInfos.name: time_calculation

metaInfos.description: Information on date and timings.
metaInfos.name: time_info

metaInfos.description: End time of the run on CPU 1.
metaInfos.name: time_run_cpu1_end

metaInfos.description: Start time of the run on CPU 1.
metaInfos.name: time_run_cpu1_start

metaInfos.description: End date of run stored as time since the unix epoch (00:00:00 UTC on 1 January 1970) in seconds.
metaInfos.name: time_run_date_end

metaInfos.description: Start date of the run stored as time since the unix epoch (00:00:00 UTC on 1 January 1970) in seconds.
metaInfos.name: time_run_date_start

metaInfos.description: Internal wall-clock time at the end of the run.
metaInfos.name: time_run_wall_end

metaInfos.description: Internal wall-clock time at the start of the run.
metaInfos.name: time_run_wall_start

metaInfos.description: End time of an scf iteration on CPU 1.
metaInfos.name: time_scf_iteration_cpu1_end

metaInfos.description: Start time of an scf iteration on CPU 1.
metaInfos.name: time_scf_iteration_cpu1_start

metaInfos.description: End date of scf stored as time since the unix epoch (00:00:00 UTC on 1 January 1970) in seconds.
metaInfos.name: time_scf_iteration_date_end

metaInfos.description: Start date of an scf iteration stored as time since the unix epoch (00:00:00 UTC on 1 January 1970) in seconds.
metaInfos.name: time_scf_iteration_date_start

metaInfos.description: Internal wall clock time at the end of an scf iteration.
metaInfos.name: time_scf_iteration_wall_end

metaInfos.description: Internal wall clock time at the start of an scf iteration.
metaInfos.name: time_scf_iteration_wall_start

metaInfos.description: End time of the single configuration calculation on CPU 1.
metaInfos.name: time_single_configuration_calculation_cpu1_end

metaInfos.description: Start time of the single configuration calculation on CPU 1.
metaInfos.name: time_single_configuration_calculation_cpu1_start

metaInfos.description: End date of the single configuration calculation stored as time since the unix epoch (00:00:00 UTC on 1 January 1970) in seconds. Default to GMT timezone for date and times without timezone.
metaInfos.name: time_single_configuration_calculation_date_end

metaInfos.description: Start date of the single configuration calculation stored as time since the unix epoch (00:00:00 UTC on 1 January 1970) in seconds. Default to GMT timezone for date and times without timezone.
metaInfos.name: time_single_configuration_calculation_date_start

metaInfos.description: Internal wall clock time at the end of the single configuration calculation.
metaInfos.name: time_single_configuration_calculation_wall_end

metaInfos.description: Internal wall clock time at the start of the single configuration calculation.
metaInfos.name: time_single_configuration_calculation_wall_start

metaInfos.description: A unique string idenfiying the force field defined in this section. Strategies to define it are discussed in the [topology\_force\_field\_name](https://gitlab.mpcdf.mpg.de/nomad-lab/nomad-meta-info/wikis/metainfo/topology-force-field-name).
metaInfos.name: topology_force_field_name

metaInfos.description: Reference to the topology used for this system; if not given, the trivial topology should be assumed.
metaInfos.name: topology_ref

metaInfos.description: Total charge of the system.
metaInfos.name: total_charge

metaInfos.description: Short string describing the van der Waals method. No such method, if skipped or empty. Van der Waals treatement strings are described on the [van\_der\_Waals\_method wiki page](https://gitlab.mpcdf.mpg.de/nomad-lab/nomad-meta-info/wikis/metainfo/van-der-Waals-method).
metaInfos.name: van_der_Waals_method

metaInfos.description: Reference to the cell-associated basis function to use for the wavefunctions.
metaInfos.name: wavefunctions_basis_set_cell_associated_ref

metaInfos.description: Exchange correlation (XC) functional used for the final energy and related quantities in a unique short obtained combining the data in section_XC_functionals as described in the [XC\_functional wiki page](https://gitlab.mpcdf.mpg.de/nomad-lab/nomad-meta-info/wikis/metainfo/XC-functional).
metaInfos.name: XC_functional

metaInfos.description: Name of one of the exchange correlation (XC) functionals combined in XC_functional. The valid unique names that can be used are defined in [XC\_functional wiki page](https://gitlab.mpcdf.mpg.de/nomad-lab/nomad-meta-info/wikis/metainfo/XC-functional).
metaInfos.name: XC_functional_name

metaInfos.description: Dictionary containing non default values of the parameters for the functional XC_functional_name. The names and units of these values should be defined in the section dedicated to XC_functional_name of the [XC\_functional wiki page](https://gitlab.mpcdf.mpg.de/nomad-lab/nomad-meta-info/wikis/metainfo/XC-functional). If not given, the default parameter values for the XC_functional are assumed.
metaInfos.name: XC_functional_parameters

metaInfos.description: Weigth that should be given to XC_functional_name when combining it to obtain XC_functional. If not given it defaults to 1.
metaInfos.name: XC_functional_weight

metaInfos.description: Exchange correlation (XC) method used for energy_XC consisting of XC_method_current plus '@' and the XC_method of the method_to_method_ref with method_to_method_kind = starting\_point_method for perturbative methods.
metaInfos.name: XC_method

metaInfos.description: Exchange correlation (XC) method used for energy_XC and related quantities in standarized short form. Built joining the values in the following order: post_hartree_fock_method '_' XC_functional '_' self_interaction_correction_method '_' van_der_Waals_method '_' relativity_method. Finally a '_' and the first 10 characters of the base64 url encoding of SHA 512 checksum of a normalized json with all non redundant non derived settings_XC appended to make the string unique for every setting. With empty strings the connecting character is skipped. If done perturbatively this writes only the perturbation method, not the reference.
metaInfos.name: XC_method_current
